# AI Agent Instructions for portfolio-experiment

## Project Overview

This is a React-based portfolio website built with Vite, deployed to GitHub Pages. The project emphasizes clean component structure and automated CI/CD deployment. Built and tested with AI assistance.

## Architecture & Key Patterns

### Component Structure
- **Single Component Design**: [src/Portfolio.jsx](src/Portfolio.jsx) exports the main `Portfolio` component—this is the entire application.
- **Data as Constants**: Project data lives in a `projects` array within the component (lines 3-25), not in separate config files.
- **CSS Co-location**: [src/Portfolio.css](src/Portfolio.css) is imported directly into the JSX file for styling the component.
- **Entry Point**: [src/index.jsx](src/index.jsx) mounts the Portfolio component to the DOM root; minimal setup.

### Styling Approach
- Single CSS file (`Portfolio.css`) with class-based styling.
- BEM-like naming convention: `.portfolio`, `.hero`, `.hero-links`, `.skills`, `.projects`, `.project-card`.
- Responsive design using max-width container (900px) and CSS flexbox/grid.
- Color scheme: Blue accents (#3b82f6, #1565c0) on light background (#f6f7fb).

## Build & Deployment Workflow

### Local Development
```bash
npm install        # Install React 18.2.0 and Vite 5+
npm run dev        # Start dev server (typically http://localhost:5173)
npm run build      # Build for production → outputs to `dist/`
npm run preview    # Preview production build locally
```

### Deployment Strategy
- **Two Deployment Methods** (both active):
  1. **GitHub Pages via `gh-pages.yml`**: Publishes `dist/` to `gh-pages` branch → https://eli-evans149.github.io/portfolio-experiment/
  2. **GitHub Pages via `deploy-docs.yml`**: Builds and commits `dist/` to `docs/` folder on `main` branch → same URL

- **Vite Base Path**: [vite.config.js](vite.config.js) sets `base: '/portfolio-experiment/'` to ensure assets resolve correctly under the repository subpath.
- **Critical**: When renaming the repository, update the `base` path in `vite.config.js` and workflows accordingly.

## Content Management

### Adding/Updating Portfolio Projects
1. Edit the `projects` array in [src/Portfolio.jsx](src/Portfolio.jsx) (lines 3–25).
2. Each project object requires: `title`, `description`, `tech`, `image` (URL string), `link`.
3. Currently image URLs are empty strings; fill with external URLs (e.g., GitHub, Imgur).
4. Run `npm run build` to generate updated `dist/` for preview/deployment.

### Personal Information
- Hero section: Update avatar URL (line 42), name, and tagline in [src/Portfolio.jsx](src/Portfolio.jsx).
- Skills list: Keep synchronized with core tech stack in the "Core technologies" line (line 60).
- Links: Email, GitHub, LinkedIn hardcoded (lines 44–46); update if contact info changes.

## Development Conventions

### When to Modify Files
- **Component Logic/UI**: Edit [src/Portfolio.jsx](src/Portfolio.jsx).
- **Styling**: Edit [src/Portfolio.css](src/Portfolio.css); use existing class naming pattern.
- **Build Config**: Modify [vite.config.js](vite.config.js) only for base path or plugin changes.
- **Entry Point**: Avoid editing [src/index.jsx](src/index.jsx) unless adding React Context, global providers, or error boundaries.

### React & Dependencies
- React 18.2.0 with ReactDOM for client-side rendering.
- No state management (Redux, Zustand, etc.)—component is purely presentational.
- No external UI library (Material-UI, Bootstrap)—all styling is custom CSS.

### HTML & Assets
- Main HTML template: [index.html](index.html); only modify if adding meta tags or changing root element ID.
- GitHub avatar is loaded from GitHub API (`https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/14357612`).

## Troubleshooting & Common Tasks

- **Assets not loading**: Check `base` path in `vite.config.js` matches the repository URL path.
- **Build fails**: Ensure Node.js 18+ is used (workflows use node-version: '18' and '20').
- **Deployment stuck**: Both workflows may conflict; consider disabling `gh-pages.yml` if using `deploy-docs.yml`.
- **Local dev crashes**: Run `npm ci` to ensure exact dependency versions; delete `node_modules/` and `package-lock.json` if issues persist.

## Git & Repository Expectations

- Main branch is the deployment trigger for both workflows.
- `docs/` folder is auto-generated by `deploy-docs.yml`; do not manually edit files in `docs/`.
- Workflow commits include `[skip ci]` to prevent recursive builds.
- Repository name: `portfolio-experiment`; used in deployment paths and configuration.
